episode_title: 512 - The One With Chandler’s Work Laugh

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is trying to pry more information about Chandler and Monica from Joey who’s sitting on the couch and busy downing a pizza.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on Joey!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Rach, I told you everything I knew last night! Look, it’s not that big of a deal, so Monica and Chandler are doing it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can’t believe you would say that!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sorry. Monica and Chandler are making love.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! I mean come on! This is a huge deal! (She sits next to him on the couch.) Fine I want—I need more details, who-who initiated the first kiss?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Is he romantic with her?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are they in love?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You don’t know anything.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh, I know one thing!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They did it right there on the couch.
(He points to where she’s sitting and she jumps up quickly.)

content.description: Central Perk, everyone is there as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Ross!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey-yeah. (He hurries up to the counter.) Hey Gunther, can I have a scone please? (To the gang.) Wanna hear some good news? Someone I know is getting married! Yeah! And weddings are happy occasions! Oh, by-the-by it’s my ex-wife Emily!

content.speaker: All
content.text: What? Oh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sorry man.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Here’s your scone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, thanks Gunther. (He takes it, hands the plate it’s on to Rachel, sets it down on the table, and proceeds to pound it into oblivion while saying.) STUPID BRITISH SNACK FOOD!!!!!!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Did they teach you that in your anger management class?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, you know what might help you deal with it? Think of it this way, you and Emily are in the past and you can’t be mad about the past. So are you still mad about the Louisiana Purchase?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs, I don’t think anyone’s mad about that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Exactly! Because it’s in the past!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Anybody gonna eat that?

content.description: Chandler’s office, Monica and him are at a party his office is throwing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look at us all dressed up for the big office party! By the way, what are we celebrating?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, we had a lot of liquor left over from the Christmas party.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think this is so cool because none of our friends are here and we can be a real couple. We don’t have to hide.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know, I can do this. (He takes her hand.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ooh, and I can do this. (She kisses him on the cheek.)
(They both stand real close together.)

content.speaker: Both
content.text: We can’t do that. (They separate.)
(Chandler’s boss (Doug) walks up.)

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Hey Bing! (Slaps him on his ass.) (Sees Monica) Wo-ho-ho, who’s the pretty lady and what the hell is she doing with you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I asked myself that very question, sir. Uh, (Points to Monica) this is Monica. (Points to his boss.) This is my boss, Doug. Doug this is Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, nice to meet you!

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Hi! And this is my wife Kara.

content.speaker: Kara
content.text: Nice to meet you Monica. Bing! (Slaps Chandler on his butt.)

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Say uh, Bing, did you hear about the new law firm we got working for us?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, sir.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Yeah, Dewey, Cheatum, and Howe.
(Chandler does a fake laugh.)

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Come on honey, let’s go drink our body weight. (They walk off leaving Chandler and Monica alone.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What was that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That noise you just made?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, that was my work laugh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really? Your work laugh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, believe me, to survive this party, you’re gonna have to come up with one too.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, check me out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.
(She walks up to where Doug is finishing another joke to another group.)

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: …says $30 Father; same as in town.
(Monica does a fake laugh. For the laughs, you’ll have to see the episode. I can’t describe them.)

content.description: Central Perk, Monica is buying a muffin as Chandler runs in.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! Everybody at work loved you last night!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And ! They like me more just because I was with ya! I think you repaired a lot of the damage from when they met Joey. And Doug wants us to play tennis with them. He’s never even talked to me outside of work. Except for that time when we bumped into each other at that strip club. (She glares at him.) Strip church. Anyway, I’m gonna go try and find a racquet.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, I thought you already had one.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh I used too, but then Joey thought it would be fun to go to Central Park and hit rocks at…bigger rocks. (He starts to leave and stops an entering Rachel.) Hey Rach, do you have a tennis racquet?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh umm, y’know I lent it to Joey and I never actually got it back.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, good luck with that. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s up?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you doing here? I thought you had to do inventory all day.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well yeah, I do, but I decided to take a long lunch and spend some time with my friend Monica. Y’know I-I feel that we don’t talk anymore. How are you? What is new with you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uhh, not much. Uh, work’s good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh y’know what, we don’t have to talk about work. We can talk about anything!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. Umm…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Y’know what? Let’s talk about relationships!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, what’s going on with you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nothing! You go!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I-I—there was this guy at the bank that I thought was cute umm, but I don’t anymore.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow that’s uh, juicy. Umm, (checks watch) y’know what though Mon, I actually do have a lot of work to do so if-if—are you sure there’s just not anything else?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes, I’m sure! Rachel is there something that you want to talk me about?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! (Gets up to leave.) (Under her breath.) If there was I wouldn’t tell you.

content.description: Chandler, Joey, and Ross’s, Phoebe is settling a dispute between the chick and the duck.

content.text: (The duck quacks.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, then what happened?
(The duck flaps its wings frantically.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh. Uh-huh. Uh-huh. (The chick clucks.) You’ll get your turn!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Pheebs, what’s going on?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nothing! (Picks up and sets the chick down on the floor.) (To the chick.) This is not over!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No! No!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I was up all night writing this really nasty letter to Emily! It was perfect and now it’s all covered in-in… (The duck quacks.) Actually, thanks!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! Everybody ready to go to the movies?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh actually, I think I’m gonna skip it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I’m gonna stay and read my book. I just wanna be alone right now.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh. Are you sure you don’t want to come? Tom Hanks, Meg Ryan, they get mail and stuff.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s okay, Joe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, let’s go Pheebs.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh God!
content.parenthetical: licks the envelope and encounters a foreign substance on the glue.

content.description: A tennis court somewhere in the city of New York, it’s the doubles match-up of a century Chandler and Monica versus Doug and Kara.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Bing!
(Hits the ball towards Chandler who returns it back to him. He then hits the ball at Monica who slams it and it bounces off Kara’s leg.)

content.speaker: Kara
content.text: Oww!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Game!

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Well, I gotta tell ya Bing; that partner of yours is a real tiger. (To his wife.) Are you all right sweethart?

content.speaker: Kara
content.text: I’m not all right.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: We’re, we’re just gonna get a little sip of water.
(They both walk off the court.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Am I on fire today or what?! Those birds are browned, basted, and ready to be carved!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, easy Martina. I think we should let them win the next game.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry, I don’t understand what you just said.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Let them win one.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you crazy?! We own those two! I mean look at ‘um, he can’t breath and she’s popping pills.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re not even giving them a chance!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They have racquets don’t they?!

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Uh Bing, I think we’re gonna make this the last game.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yes, sir! Put me out of my misery. Are you sure you never played pro? (Does his work laugh.) (To Monica) Please let them win!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll take it down to 95% but that’s the best I can do.
(She serves to Doug who returns it to Chandler. As it bounces over his head Chandler swings and misses.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oopsey, missed it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I got it! (She hits a forehand smash that bounces right in between Doug and Kara and scores a point.)

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Nice shot.
(Chandler glares at her and she shrugs her shoulders. Monica serves again; and Kara returns it.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I got it!!
(Chandler cuts in front of her and hits the ball high and long.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Long! (Gives Monica the Work Laugh.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Chandler are returning from the game.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe you let them win!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, at least you hid your feelings well about it. (Removes a smashed racquet from his bag.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I was frustrated.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It was my racquet.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I was frustrated with you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If we hadn’t lost the game they never would’ve invented us to dinner tomorrow night.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what really bothers me? Is—it’s how-how different you act around them! I mean y’know the throwing the tennis games, the fake laugh, the “I’ll see you around, Bing!” “Not if I see you first, Doug!” (Mocks the fake laugh.) I gotta tell you, I don’t like Work Chandler. Okay? The guy’s a suck-up.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay y’know what, because you said that, I’m not putting out tonight.

content.description: Chandler, Joey, and Ross’s, the next morning the girls are there with Joey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m telling you, something’s wrong! My brother does not stay out all night.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe we should check the trash chute.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross couldn’t fit down the trash chute.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s right, he almost could. Which is exactly how I got stuck there.
(Ross enters.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: There he is!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! (She goes to hug him, stops short, and hits him on the shoulder.) Where the hell have you been?!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just, y’know out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, out, oh God, I don’t know why we didn’t think to check there!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What were you doing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I uh, went to a bar. And then I just uh, just walked around for a while.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You walked around all night in the city by yourself?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He hooked up! He hooked up with someone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I don’t have to answer your questions! Okay? I’m a big boy, I can do whatever I want!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He hooked up!! Tell us about her!
[Suddenly the door opens and Ross’s mystery girl enters. I’ll give you a hint to who it is: OH…MY…GAWD!! Uh-huh, it’s Janice.]

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Ross you left you scarf in…(sees everyone.) Hey you guys. (Does the laugh.)
(They all turn and with shocked looks on their faces stare at Ross. Ross is at a loss for words at this moment.)

content.description: Chandler, Joey, and Ross’s, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Uh-oh-okay. Uh-oh-okay. I know what you all are thinking. But Chandler is in Yemen ! I’m a young woman! I have needs! I can’t wait forever!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! No that’s what I was thinking.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: So I’m asking you please, take a moment before you judge me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, nobody’s judging you. (They all turn and look at Ross.)

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh! Okay! (To Ross) You, Mister Right Place at the Right Time, call me! (Does her famous, or is that infamous, laugh and exits.)
(They all turn and glare at Ross.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, look, I-I know what you guys are going to say…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You two will have very hairy children.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I didn’t know you would say that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross! Janice?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, hold on! Hold on. Hold on. This is Ross, okay? He’s our friend. He obviously went crazy. He obviously lost his mind.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I didn’t lose my mind! Okay, Janice and I have a lot in common! We’ve-we’ve both been divorced. We-we both have kids.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So are you actually gonna see her again?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Phoebe! Don’t put ideas in his head!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I am gonna see her again.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Damnit Phoebe!!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is going through her purse as Rachel rushes in.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, I have to tell you something that I have never admitted during our entire friendship! But, when we were in high school I made out with James Farrell even when I knew that you liked him! Wow, that feels so good to get off my chest! Okay, you go!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My turn? What-what are you talking about?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh, Monica, I know about you and Chandler.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I overheard you guys on the phone the other day, and you said, “I’ll just tell Rachel that I’m doing laundry for a couple of hours.” And he said, “Laundry? Is that my new nickname?” And you said, “No! You know what your nickname is, Mr. Big.”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well. Sounds like you’re writing yourself a little play there Rach. Wow! Let me know how that one turns out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I wouldn’t know because I got so freaked out that I hung up the phone.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, if you had kept listening, you-you would have heard me call him Mr. Big…(Thinks)…ot.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mr. Bigot. He tells the most racist jokes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right. So you’re telling me that there is nothing going on between you and Chandler.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Me and Chandler?! (Does her fake laugh.)

content.description: Chandler, Joey, and Ross’s, Phoebe and Joey are there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, put your 20 bucks down. First one to find the tasty treat wins. Okay?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-hmm.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right. Let’s get the contestants out of their isolation booths. (He removes the waste bucket that’s over the duck and the laundry basket that’s over the chicken.) And they’re off! (He puts his foot in front of the chick, stopping it from moving.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Get your foot off my contestant! Judge!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Judge rules, no violation.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohhh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey guys!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!
(Neither of them turns around from watching the chick and the duck look for the tasty treat.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what? It sounds so weird to say this but, I just had a great day with Janice!
(They both turn around.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you serious?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah! I opened up to her about all the terrible stuff that’s been happening to me. I mean I talked for hours. (Joey has lost interest and is watching the race again.) It is amazing to have someone give you such-such focused attention.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You don’t need Janice for that, you’ve got us. We…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And the duck gets the Nutter-Butter!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No!! Hey-hey that’s not a Nutter-Butter, that’s just an old Wonton!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Judge rules, Nutter-Butter.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, tough call.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.description: Doug’s house, Chandler, Monica, and them are just finishing dinner.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: But seriously, I believe that we should all support President Clinton. And her husband Bill. (Chandler does the laugh.)

content.speaker: Kara
content.text: So how do you kids like your coffee?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, none for me. Thanks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Just a little bit of sugar.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Well, maybe I’ll bring it out and have Monica stick her finger in it. That oughta sweeten it up, huh? (Once again, with the laugh.)
(Doug and Kara go get the coffee.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How does that laugh not give you a headache?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, you get used to it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, I-I-I don’t think that I can. So if you don’t mind, maybe this will be it for me on the work things.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So I laugh at my boss’s jokes, what’s the big deal?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’d rather hang out with a sniveling work weasel guy when I can be hanging out with my boyfriend who I actually respect.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh. (Does a double take when he realizes what she just said.)

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Uh, I gotta apologize for Kara’s coffee. Y’know, I feel sorry for it if it ever got in a fight, it’s not strong enough to defend itself. (Chandler does not laugh.) Did you hear what I said Bing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: The joke Bing. What’s the matter with you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I-I just didn’t think it was funny sir.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Excuse me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I just…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, I just don’t think that you understood the joke.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! I mean it was really funny, I-I just don’t think you got it. You see Kara’s coffee is-is-is weak tasting, okay? But-but what Doug was-was imply that it was weak physically. You get it now honey?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I think I do! (They all laugh.) Thank you, Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I thought you could use the help.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Coffee in a fight! (Does the laugh again.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is going through the mail as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Rach! Hey, you mind if I read my comic books in here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sure! Why?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh well, Chandler and Monica are over there and it’s kinda hard to concentrate.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! She just called and said that she was gonna be working late! She keeps lying to me! That’s it! Y’know what? I’m just gonna go over there and confront them right now!
[Cut to Chandler, Joey, and Ross’s apartment, Rachel enters and sneaks up to Chandler’s bedroom where she overhears Chandler and Monica talking.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, so you’re telling me that I have to tell racist jokes now?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sorry! I’m just—I’m not very good at this! I’m a terrible liar and I hate having to lie to Rachel!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But we’re not ready to tell yet!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know! It’s just that…ever since high school Rachel was the one person I told everything too. Y’know? I miss that so much now. She’s my best friend.
(Rachel decides not to confront them and starts to walk out, knocking over a lamp in the process.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey?! Oh my God, Rachel!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wh-wh-what are you doing here? (She tries to pull her shirt down to cover the fact that she’s wearing men’s boxers.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I was actually—I-I came over here to-to borrow this lamp. To umm, look at my books, y’know, see them a little better.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay great!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Great! Umm, well what-what I was doing in Chandler’s room is that umm, I was cleaning it! In fact, he pays me to clean it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! What a great way to earn some extra pocket money.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know when I said to you earlier that I was at work umm, I’m at my new work.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s good enough. Right? (Pause.) Okay, well umm, I’m gonna go look at my books!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll get back to my new job.
(Pause.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: ’kay. (Pause.) Congratulations on your new job. (She goes and hugs Monica and is almost in tears.)
(After she exits, Chandler enters.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Man, she is really gullible.
(Monica motions that it went right over Rachel’s head.)

content.description: Central Perk, Ross and Janice are sitting on the couch.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Here you go. (Serves them both some coffee.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Actually, I should get going.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you sure? Because I can stay out as late as you want. I told you how I’m on sabbatical from work, right?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Yes! Yes! You did!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh…

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: What is wrong now?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This isn’t what I ordered! Man! Can anything go right in my life?! First my marriage falls apart and then…

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: I know! I know! And then you lose your apartment! And then you lose your job! And then your ex-wife gets married so fast! And now the coffee—ahh!! Ross, we need to talk.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. Sometimes I feel…

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: No-no-no, no. I’m going to talk. I believe that the sun has set on our day in the sun.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: You’re a very sweet person Ross, umm, unfortunately I don’t think I can take another second of you whining!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Let-let me make sure I’m hearing this right, you’re ending this with me because I’m too whiney? (Janice makes an agreeing sound.) So you’re saying, I’ve become so whiney that I annoy you , Janice.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Well yeah!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OH…MY…GOD!!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Are you gonna be okay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I am now.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Okay.
(Joey enters.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Umm, hi.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh hi! Well, I guess that’s two out of three, Joey. (Laughs and exits.)
(Joey looks at Ross with a horrified look on his face.)

content.description: Chandler, Joey, and Ross’s, Chandler is reading a magazine as Ross hands him a beer.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dude, we got to talk.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just wanted to tell you something before you heard it from someone else and I hope this isn’t too weird, but uh, I had uh, a thing with Janice. (He laughs, his real laugh this time.) What you’re-you’re not mad?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why would I be mad?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, because y’know there are certain rules about this kind of stuff. You don’t uh, you don’t fool around with your uh, friend’s ex-girlfriends or possible girlfriends or girls they’re related to.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I am mad! But you know what I’m gonna do? I’m gonna forgive you! Because that’s what friends do! They forgive their friends when they do everything you just said, all on the list there. Well, but I want you to remember that I forgave you.
content.parenthetical: realizes what Ross just said and the implications to him

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I also want you to remember that I let you live here rent free!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And, I want you to remember that I gave you twenty (counts his money) seven dollars. No strings attached. Now, if you can’t remember that, I think we should write it down—let’s write it down!
